example.text: Upcoming Financial Services Committee FTX Hearing Next week, The House Financial Services Committee will hold a hearing on FTX where we plan to get to the bottom of the events that led to the fall of FTX and their scam on American retail investors. The Wall Street Journal reports that there will be up to 1 million creditors as a result of the fall of FTX.

Depoliticizing Retirement Accounts Last week, I introduced bipartisan legislation with US Senator Mike Braun (R-IN) and US Senator Joe Manchin (D-WV) ending Biden's politicization of retirement accounts. Biden's Department of Labor issued a rule permitting retirement plans to consider environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investing.

News from Congressman Barr December 9, 2022 Congressional Update from US Congressman Andy Barr The Carol Act is Headed to the President's Desk Monday, the House unanimously passed the CAROL Act, sending the bill to President Biden's desk. Thousands of Americans, predominantly young women, lose their lives to mitral valve prolapse and other valvular heart diseases each year.
That's why I was the first member of Congress to call on the President's national security team to resign. It's shameful that they still remain in their positions.

Previewing the Next Congress with Spectrum News On Sunday, I joined Mario Anderson on "In Focus" to discuss the Republican Majority's Commitment to America Agenda that we will focus on advancing out of the House next year. We will implement policies to reduce inflation by unleashing American energy producers to lower costs, stop the overspending in Washington, and bring home essential supply chains from overseas to create good paying American jobs.

They have a sophisticated plan to challenge the United States and leverage every possible avenue to finance their goals. Defending against these advances is one of the most significant geopolitical challenges of a generation.

The CAROL Act invests in the innovative research that is necessary to put high risk patients on a path to living long and healthy lives. I can't think of a better way to honor Carol Barr, whose selflessness and service to her community and country will be furthered through the law that will bear her name.
